result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L Buehring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Use Different Name, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.47(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Huber granted for work and counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy.

Provide DNA Sample if requested.
Participate in any other assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with all requirements of the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.
Any bond posted is to be applied to costs and surcharges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Buehring

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin L Buehring in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:38 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to the single count.

Atty McFarland concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court informs Defendant as to voting rights and firearm rights.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Atty McFarland acknowledges prior offense.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: As alleged

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, Imposed and Stayed
2 days jail credit
Huber granted for work and counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample if requested
Participate in any other assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
Comply with all requirements of the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry 
Any bond posted is to be applied to costs and surcharges
Plea hearing on September 18, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin L Buehring in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:13 a.m.  Court calls the case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Case to be pre-tried today and State to file a report.
Preliminary hearing on May 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin L Buehring in court with attorney Acalia Halverson on behalf of Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:30 p.m. Atty Cousins calls the case and states the appearances.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin L Buehring in court. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant is not currently employed. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn to allow for counsel.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Comply with all requirements of the sex offender registry.

Defendant Justin L Buehring appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:20 PM Court calls case.
This is a return on a warrant.

Court states appearances.

There was a failure to appear at the initial appearance back in December.
Court questions Defendant as to why he did not appear.

Defendant is on extended supervision. 
Address is verified.

Court continues questioning Defendant.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant understands.
Court informs Defendant right to counsel/public defender's office.
Defendant is not working at this time. 

Court will continue this case until April 3, 2017.

State addresses bond, requests cash bond.

Defendant addresses the Court regarding bond, requests signature bond.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
